definition: member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: He's taking some of the old and some of the new, and that's what a good scribe is like.
sentences.chinese: 他取出一些舊的和一些新的，那就是優良文士的做法。

sentences.english: 55 and the clans of scribes who lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, Shimeathites and Sucathites.
sentences.chinese: 和住雅比斯衆文士家的特拉人，示米押人，蘇甲人。

sentences.english: Woe to you, teachers of the law and Pharisees, you hypocrites!
sentences.chinese: 你們這假冒爲善的文士和法利賽人有禍了。

sentences.english: And, behold, certain of the scribes said within themselves, This man blasphemeth.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個文士心裏說，這個人說僭妄的話了。

sentences.english: And they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?
sentences.chinese: 他們就問耶穌說，文士爲什麼說，以利亞必須先來。

sentences.english: And the families of the scribes which dwelt at Jabez； the Tirathites， the Shimeathites， and Suchathites.
sentences.chinese: 和住雅比斯衆文士家的特拉人，示米押人，蘇甲人。

sentences.english: Part two. Zhang Zhi"s definition of writers."
sentences.chinese: 第二部分，張騭的“文士”定位。

sentences.english: 5The next day the rulers, elders and teachers of the law met in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，官府，長老，和文士，在耶路撒冷聚會。

sentences.english: Therefore I am sending you prophets and wise men and teachers.
sentences.chinese: 所以我差譴先知和智慧人並文士，到你們這裏來。

sentences.english: But woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites!
sentences.chinese: 你們這假冒爲善的文士和法利賽人有禍了。

sentences.english: But see, the false pen of the scribes has made it false.
sentences.chinese: 看哪，文士的假筆舞弄虛假。

sentences.english: Why the scribes shall receive greater condemnations?
sentences.chinese: 文士爲何要受更重的刑罰？

sentences.english: Scribes make errors, so only the official tour later.
sentences.chinese: 誤作好文士，只令遊宦遲。

sentences.english: But the chief priests and the scribes and the chief of the people sought to destroy him
sentences.chinese: 祭司長，和文士，與百姓的尊長，都想要殺他。

sentences.english: There is, therefore, a staff of subaltern officials and scribes of all sorts.
sentences.chinese: 還有，因此，一箇中尉的官員和工作人員的各種文士。

sentences.english: Then some Pharisees and teachers of the law came to Jesus from Jerusalem and asked.
sentences.chinese: 那時有法利賽人和文士，從耶路撒冷來見耶穌說。

definition: plain cotton clothing/(literary) the common people
famous scholar/worthy/celebrity, esp. distinguished literary person having no official post
lit. pale-faced scholar (idiom); young and inexperienced person without practical experience/still wet behind the ears
experienced scholar/old expert in the field
